title: Introducing: Buzz Kull
content:
Duo’s seem to be all the rage at the moment, and Sydney’s Buzz Kull are no exception.

Comprised of Marcel Whyler and Rebecca Liston, their claustrophobic ‘doomwave’ is . industrial, disconsolate and enterprisingly intimidating. It’s sort of how I’d imagine the lovechild of The XX and The Horrors to sound, providing it had been starved of ever hearing a number one single.Their debut three tracks carve a very singular notch for the duo, building shallow, desolate caves in which they thrive. Whilst the vocals could perhaps do with slightly more production at times, the likes of Fallen Flower and I Disappear have limitless potential, that hopefully, will be fulfilled. Check out Fallen Flower below and hit up their bandcamp for free downloads of their tree debut tracks.

Fallen Flower by Buzz Kull
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
